Class FileSource

public abstract class FileSource extends DatasetSource
Common functionality for file-based sources.

  • Field Details

    • extension

      @Nonnull protected final String extension
      The file extension that this source expects for its source files.

    • reader

      @Nonnull protected final DataFrameReader reader
      A DataFrameReader that can be used to read the source files.

    • transformer

      @Nonnull protected final BiFunction<Dataset<Row>,String,Dataset<Row>> transformer
      A function that transforms a Dataset containing raw source data of a specified resource type into a Dataset containing the imported data.

    • additionalResourceTypeFilter

      @Nonnull protected final Predicate<String> additionalResourceTypeFilter
      An additional filter to exclude specific resource types from being processed. This filter is applied after standard resource type validation and extension checking. Use this to selectively exclude resource types that should not be loaded, even if they are present in the source files and would otherwise be valid. The predicate receives the resource type code as a string.

  • Constructor Details

    • FileSource

      protected FileSource(@Nonnull PathlingContext context, @Nonnull String path, @Nonnull Function<String,Set<String>> fileNameMapper, @Nonnull String extension, @Nonnull DataFrameReader reader, @Nonnull BiFunction<Dataset<Row>,String,Dataset<Row>> transformer, @Nonnull Predicate<String> additionalResourceTypeFilter)
      Path-based constructor that scans a directory to discover FHIR data files.

      Use this constructor when you have a directory containing FHIR files and want Pathling to automatically discover and group them by resource type based on file names. This is the typical approach for reading from a file system directory where files follow a naming convention (e.g., Patient.ndjson, Observation.parquet).

      The constructor will scan the specified path and use either the provided fileNameMapper or the default naming convention (<resource_type>.<extension>) to determine which files contain which resource types. Files may also include a partition identifier (e.g., Patient.00000.ndjson) which will be handled automatically.

      Parameters:
      context - the Pathling context
      path - the path to the source files, which may be a directory or a glob pattern
      fileNameMapper - a function that maps a file name to a set of resource types, or null to use the default naming convention
      extension - the file extension that this source expects for its source files
      reader - a DataFrameReader that can be used to read the source files
      transformer - a function that transforms a Dataset containing raw source data of a specified resource type into a Dataset containing the imported data
      additionalResourceTypeFilter - filter to filter out specific resource types if desired, receives the resource type code as a string

    • FileSource

      protected FileSource(@Nonnull PathlingContext context, @Nonnull Map<String,Collection<String>> files, @Nonnull String extension, @Nonnull DataFrameReader reader, @Nonnull BiFunction<Dataset<Row>,String,Dataset<Row>> transformer, @Nonnull Predicate<String> additionalResourceTypeFilter)
      Map-based constructor for programmatically specifying which files contain which resource types.

      Use this constructor when you already know the mapping between resource types and file paths, and want to provide this information explicitly rather than relying on file name conventions. This is particularly useful for:

      • FHIR Bulk Data operations where file lists are provided via manifests
      • Custom file organisation schemes that don't follow standard naming conventions
      • Programmatic data source construction where file-to-resource mappings are computed
      • Reading from multiple partitioned files (e.g., Patient.00000.ndjson, Patient.00001.ndjson) for a single resource type

      Unlike the path-based constructor, this does not scan directories or infer resource types from file names. All file-to-resource-type mappings must be provided explicitly in the files parameter.

      Parameters:
      context - the Pathling context
      files - a map where keys are resource type codes (e.g., "Patient", "Observation") and values are collections of file paths containing data for that resource type
      extension - the file extension that this source expects for its source files
      reader - a DataFrameReader that can be used to read the source files
      transformer - a function that transforms a Dataset containing raw source data of a specified resource type into a Dataset containing the imported data
      additionalResourceTypeFilter - filter to filter out specific resource types if desired, receives the resource type code as a string

  • Method Details

    • resourceNameWithQualifierMapper

      @Nonnull public static Set<String> resourceNameWithQualifierMapper(@Nonnull String baseName)
      Extracts the resource type from the provided base name. Allows for an optional qualifier string, which is separated from the resource name by a period. For example, "Procedure.ICU" will return ["Procedure"].

      This method does not validate that the resource type is a valid FHIR resource type.

      Parameters:
      baseName - the base name of the file
      Returns:
      a single-element set containing the resource type, or an empty set if the base name does not match the expected format
